g.H410: strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
g.H6944: a sacred place or thing; rarely abstract, sanctity
g.H5797: strength in various applications (force, security, majesty, praise)
g.H7549: properly, an expanse, i.e. the firmament or (apparently) visible arch of the sky

g.H1369: force (literally or figuratively); by implication, valor, victory

g.H7782: a cornet (as giving a clear sound) or curved horn
g.H5035: a skin-bag for liquids (from collapsing when empty); hence, a vase (as similar in shape when full); also a lyre (as having a body of like form)

g.H4482: a musical chord (as parted into strings)

g.H8088: something heard, i.e. a sound, rumor, announcement; abstractly, audience
g.H6767: a clatter, i.e. (abstractly) whirring (of wings); (concretely) a cricket; also a harpoon (as rattling), a cymbal (as clanging)
g.H8643: clamor, i.e. acclamation of joy or a battle-cry; especially clangorof trumpets, as an alarum

g.H3605: properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
g.H5397: a puff, i.e. wind, angry or vital breath, divine inspiration, intellect. or (concretely) an animal
